item.value: This function is called internally in the application's main loop and does not need to be called explicitly.
@description Render the application's scene. More specifically, the scene's {@link LayerComposition} is rendered by the application's {@link ForwardRenderer}.
sync Hierarchy
Timing stats
Depending on browser add the correct visibiltychange event and store the name of the hidden attribute in this._hiddenAttr.
@description Get the current application. In the case where there are multiple running applications, the function can get an application based on a supplied canvas id.
@description Get the current application. In the case where there are multiple running applications, the function can get an application based on a supplied canvas id. This
this.tick = makeTick(this); Circular linting issue as makeTick and Application reference each other
eslint-disable-next-line no-use-before-define
bind tick function to current scope
@classdesc Resource handler used for loading {@link Render} resources.
@param {StandardMaterial} defaultMaterial - The shared default material that is used in any place that a material is not specified.
enable if you want entity type script attributes to not be re-mapped when an entity is cloned
Handles localization.
@description Handles localization.
@description Set to true to render the scene on the next iteration of the main loop.
@description The graphics device used by the application.
Clamps per-frame delta time to an upper bound. Useful since returning from a tab deactivation can generate huge values for dt, which can adversely affect game state.
tone mapping
An Application represents and manages your PlayCanvas application.
removes skin instance from the cache. This decreases ref count, and when that reaches 0 it gets destroyed

map of SkinInstances allowing those to be shared between render components (specifically a single glb with multiple render components) maps rootBone to an array of SkinInstanceCachedObject this allows to find if a skin instance already exists for a rootbone, and a specific skin
returns already created skin instance from skin, for use on the rootBone ref count of existing skinInstance is increased
Stop rendering {@link MeshInstance}s without removing them from the scene hierarchy.
Class used as an entry in the ref-counted skin instance cache
map of SkinInstances allowing those to be shared between render components
@classdesc Component Systems contain the logic and functionality to update all Components of a particular type.
@classdesc Allows an Entity to render a mesh or a primitive shape like a box, capsule, sphere, cylinder, cone etc.
Pass null to turn off hardware instancing.
@param {VertexBuffer|null} vertexBuffer - Vertex buffer to hold per-instance vertex data (usually world matrices).
@param {VertexBuffer|null} vertexBuffer - Vertex buffer to hold per-instance vertex data (usually world matrices). Pass null to turn off hardware instancing.
@description Sets up {@link MeshInstance} to be rendered using Hardware Instancing.
used to apply parameters from this mesh instance into scope of uniforms, called internally by forward-renderer
a wrapper over settings parameter specifically for realtime baked lightmaps. This handles reference counting of lightmaps and releases them when no longer referenced
this allows us to automatically release realtime baked lightmaps when mesh instances using them are destroyed
cache of lightmaps internally created by baking using Lightmapper
generates wireframes for an array of mesh instances
A script you can attach on an entity to test if it is visible on a Layer
@classdesc An instance of a {@link Mesh}. A single mesh can be referenced by many mesh instances that can have different transforms and materials.
@param {RenderComponentSystem} system - The ComponentSystem that created this Component.
@classdesc Enables an Entity to render a {@link Mesh} or a primitive shape. This component attaches {@link MeshInstance} geometry to the Entity.
@classdesc The forward renderer render scene objects.
@param {string} [name] - The non-unique name of the entity, default is "Untitled".
ComponentSystems allow access to all Entities and Components and are attached to the {@link Application}.
Components are specific to an instance of an Entity and are attached (e.g. `this.entity.model`)

The Component and ComponentSystem provide the logic to give an Entity a specific type of behavior. e.g. the ability to render a model or play a sound. Components are specific to an instance of an Entity and are attached (e.g. `this.entity.model`) ComponentSystems allow access to all Entities and Components and are attached to the {@link Application}.
The Entity uniquely identifies the object and also provides a transform for position and orientation which it inherits from {@link GraphNode} so can be added into the scene graph.
